Read Today's Paper Gujarat State Petroleum Corp seeks LNG cargo for May delivery: Sources SECTIONS Gujarat State Petroleum Corp seeks LNG cargo for May delivery: Sources Reuters Last Updated: Apr 15, 2025, 09:52:00 AM IST Rate Story Follow us Share Font Size Abc Small Abc Medium Abc Large Save Print Comment Synopsis Gujarat State Petroleum Corp (GSPC) is looking to secure a liquefied natural gas (LNG) cargo for delivery in the second half of May. The tender for this cargo closes on April 15, according to industry sources. Agencies Gujarat State Petroleum Corp ( GSPC ) is seeking a liquefied natural gas (LNG) cargo for delivery in May, said two industry sources on Tuesday. The Indian state-owned firm is seeking the cargo for delivery in the second half of May, said one of the sources. The tender closes on April 15 . Shocking $2,000+ Price Leak Stuns Apple Fans! The Economic Times daily newspaper is available online now. Read Today's Paper iPhone Fold to Break the Bank? Shocking $2,000+ Price Leak Stuns Apple Fans! SECTIONS iPhone Fold to Break the Bank? Shocking $2,000+ Price Leak Stuns Apple Fans! The Feed Last Updated: Apr 16, 2025, 07:39:00 PM IST Rate Story Follow us Share Font Size Abc Small Abc Medium Abc Large Save Print Comment Synopsis A foldable iPhone from Apple remains one of the top expectations from tech enthusiasts around the world. As per a latest rumor, it has been suggested that the much-anticipated device will be made available anywhere between $2,100 and $2,300 by the Cupertino giant. The foldable phones market has gained significant momentum in recent times, with many tech companies launching back-to-back smartphones, with all the latest updates and specifications. Amid high expectations from fans, Apple is expected to introduce its maiden foldable iPhone soon in the global market. However, many would be surprised to know that their dream to have a foldable iPhone might not be that much affordable since it would cost more than some of the best Apple products, as per a recent leak by Instant Digital. Foldable iPhone price: What to expect? In a post on the Chinese social media platform Weibo, the rumor from the leakster suggests that the foldable iPhones may cost anywhere between $2,100 and $2,300 at the time of release. "Based on the iPhone's profit margin, the iPhone foldable screen is estimated to start at between $2,100 and $2,300, not much more expensive than Samsung," read the post. This is significantly higher in comparison with other foldable smartphones that are already available in the market, including the popular Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6. Live Events The sixth series handset from the tech giant is available at $1,899 for the lower variant, while the 1TB version costs $2,259, Tom's Guide reported. Among other popular options out there are Oppo Find N5 for roughly $1,800 and OnePlus Open at $1,699. The report suggests that the Cupertino giant will have to "pull out some impressive hardware" if at all the company is planning to sell its first ever foldable smartphones in that price range. Also Read : Sacha Parkinson welcomes first child, shares emotional photos of baby girl Sadie Foldable iPhone: Rumoured specifications 1. Screen As far as the screen of the expected foldable iPhone is concerned, several reports have suggested varied screen sizes for the handset. In March this year, it was stated that the foldable iPhone might come with a 7.8-inch primary display as well as the 5.5-inch cover display when folded. Keeping this in mind, it makes it quite similar to OnePlus Open, which remains available at a cheaper rate. Also, there have been rumors indicating that the foldable iPhone could boast a 7.74-inch inner display and a 5.49-inch outer display -- making it look close enough to the Oppo Find N5. Additionally, some have even claimed it to have a 12-inch screen when unfolded, which seems like an impractical idea. 2. Camera Cameras have remained one of the major highlights for Apple products. It is said that Apple might include a main lens, an ultrawide lens as well as a selfie camera to its rumoured foldable iPhone. Further details about the camera currently remain under the carpet. Also Read : Prince Harry, Meghan Markle jet off for spring break getaway with kids Archie and Lilibet: Report 3. Other details Rumours have suggested that the expected phone can come with a 5,000mAh battery, while the screen's integrated driver circuit has got a major upgrade from 28nm process to 16nm. FAQs 1. When will Apple release its foldable iPhone? No official details have been shared about the product, but reports claim that it can come out anytime in 2026. 2. What are the famous foldable smartphones available in the market? Some of the popular options include Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 6, OnePlus Open and Google Pixel 9 Pro Fold. Read Today's Paper Anant Ambani’s spiritual pilgrimage from Jamnagar to Dwarka nears completion SECTIONS Anant Ambani’s spiritual pilgrimage from Jamnagar to Dwarka nears completion ET Special Last Updated: Apr 01, 2025, 06:31:00 PM IST Rate Story Follow us Share Font Size Abc Small Abc Medium Abc Large Save Print Comment Synopsis Anant Ambani from Reliance Industries is undertaking a five-day padayatra from Jamnagar to Dwarka, visiting temples and engaging in prayers. Accompanied by high security, he also made an act of kindness by rescuing a truckload of chickens. His pilgrimage will conclude at the Dwarkadhish temple. ET Special Reliance Industries Director Anant Ambani has undertaken a sacred padayatra, or pilgrimage, on foot from his residence in Jamnagar to the Dwarkadhish temple in the revered city of Lord Krishna, Dwarka. This five-day pilgrimage will conclude with his visit to the temple ahead of his upcoming 30th birthday on April 9th. Covering approximately 10-12 kilometres each day, his journey has included frequent temple visits along the route, where he has been actively engaging in prayers and chants. Devotees have welcomed him with traditional recitations and blessings at various stops. Anant Ambani’s padyatra is a testament to his personal devotion and perseverance. Despite dealing with chronic health conditions such as asthma and fibrosis from a young age, he is set to cover the 140-km journey entirely on foot. The physically demanding trek would be challenging for anyone, yet for Anant, it is a spiritual commitment rather than a display of endurance. His journey reflects his deep faith in spirituality. For many young Indians navigating life’s challenges, his pilgrimage serves as a reminder that resilience can be quiet, and faith remains a powerful force. View this post on Instagram A post shared by The Economic Times (@economictimes) Beyond his spiritual commitment, Ambani also made a compassionate gesture during the journey by rescuing a truckload of chickens en route. Reports indicate that he halted the vehicle, purchased the birds, and arranged for their proper care, demonstrating his concern for animal welfare. The pilgrimage is expected to conclude soon with his prayers at the Dwarkadhish temple. His padayatra has garnered significant attention, resonating with many followers who view it as a testament to his unwavering faith and devotion. Products › Fashion / Cosmetics / Jewellery › Understanding the enduring value of natural diamonds in a changing market The Economic Times daily newspaper is available online now. Read Today's Paper Advertorial Understanding the enduring value of natural diamonds in a changing market SECTIONS Understanding the enduring value of natural diamonds in a changing market By Smita Mishra , ET Spotlight Last Updated: Apr 16, 2025, 01:23:00 PM IST Rate Story Follow us Share Font Size Abc Small Abc Medium Abc Large Save Print Comment Synopsis Natural diamonds maintain their allure in India, driven by cultural significance and rising incomes, contrasting with the fluctuating value of lab-grown alternatives. India's diamond industry thrives, processing a significant portion of the world's diamonds while prioritizing ethical sourcing and sustainability. Light performance and cut are crucial factors influencing a diamond's appearance and value. ET Spotlight Natural diamonds have long been synonymous with luxury, commitment, and legacy. In India, where weddings remain a grand affair, diamonds hold deep cultural and emotional significance. As income levels rise and the desire for luxury intensifies, the preference for natural diamonds continues to thrive, reflecting not only social status but also an investment in lasting value. Timeless and lasting appeal across generations From baby boomers to generation Z, natural diamonds hold universal appeal. Unlike alternatives that may diminish in value over time, natural diamonds retain their significance across generations. Consumers no longer seek flashy possessions; they want items that stand the test of time. Natural diamonds carry intrinsic value, rarity, and prestige— qualities that mass-produced alternatives simply cannot replicate. Even from the perspective of value and resale, natural diamonds remain a preferred choice. From 2015 to 2024, the price of a 1.5-carat diamond that is not naturally grown decreased by over 83% in some cases. According to several global reports, the future of man-made diamonds remain uncertain as producers face challenges related to profitability and market saturation. In this scenario, natural diamonds hold a competitive edge. The enduring value of natural diamonds lies in their rarity, heritage, and sustained worth. As global demand for responsibly sourced diamonds continues to grow, India's diamond industry remains at the forefront of this evolution. Live Events Natural diamonds vs. manufactured alternatives In July 2024, the United States, the world’s largest market for diamond jewellery , experienced a 6.5% growth in diamond jewellery sales. According to Paul Rowley, Vice President of Diamond Trading at De Beers, "India, on the other hand, is an emerging market expected to see double-digit growth.” Unlike mass-produced commodities that become cheaper over time, like in the semiconductor industry, natural diamonds remain rare and exclusive. In contrast, engineered gems face price drops due to large-scale production and diverse uses beyond jewellery, such as in fashion and accessories. In the U.S., the price of engineered gems has declined significantly due to increased supply and expanding applications. ET Spotlight Natural diamonds: A steady demand India's diamond industry is witnessing growth across major markets. With increasing consumer preference for responsibly-sourced natural diamonds, demand remains robust. With India now representing 11% of global demand for natural diamond jewellery , the country has surpassed China to become the second-largest market in the world. Diamonds: A major player in the economy India plays a pivotal role in the global diamond industry , processing over 90% of the world's diamonds. According to Bain & Co, despite fluctuations, natural diamond prices have seen an average year-on-year growth of 3% over the last 35 years. Furthermore, 99.8% of natural diamonds are certified conflict-free by the UN and WTO-mandated Kimberley Process (KP). Several major players are implementing responsible practices, such as the Tata Sustainability and Ethics Programme (TSEP), ensuring ethical sourcing, sustainable practices, and improved working conditions in processing units. ET Spotlight A diamond’s true magic reveals itself in the way it plays with light While the commonly considered parameters for evaluating a diamond’s quality are the four Cs—cut, clarity, colour, and carat—light performance remains the most essential factor. Diamond light performance is evaluated using several metrics that measure how effectively a stone reflects and manipulates light. True light performance is typically assessed through key factors such as brilliance, fire, scintillation, contrast, and symmetry of light return. ET Spotlight Does a larger carat mean a bigger diamond? Not necessarily. Although a higher carat usually indicates a larger diamond, its apparent size depends on several factors: Cut – A well-cut natural diamond reflects more light, making it appear larger. Shape – Some shapes, such as oval or marquise, appear larger than round diamonds of the same caratage. Depth and spread – A natural diamond with greater depth may have more weight beneath the surface.
